question: Well I don't think there was any doubt about that - You and Betty have been almost inseparable ever since you sat in on Dr Scott's refresher lectures. Yes, Janet and I are both fond of him. We drove over to see him last vacation. It's a shame his new job took him away from Denton. Who knows...ha ha.
answer: Yes.

question: Everyone knows Betty's a wonderful little cook.
answer: Yes.

question: And Ralph himself will be in line for promotion in a year or so.
answer: Yes. Yes Brad.

question: I've got something to say.
answer: Uh huh.

question: I really loved the skilful way You beat the other girls To the bride's bouquet.
answer: Oh Brad.

question: The river was deep but I swam it. The future is ours so let's plan it. So please don't tell me to can it. I've one thing to say and that's Dammit, Janet. I love you. If there's one fool for you Then I am it. I love you. Here's a ring to prove that I'm not joker. There's three ways that love can grow. That's good bad or mediocre. Oh - J - A - N - E - T I love you so.
answer: Oh!......It's nicer than Betty Munroe had Now we're engaged and I'm so glad. That you met Mom And you know Dad.

question: Oh Dammit. Oh Janet
answer: For you.

question: Gosh. That's the third motorcyclist that's passed us. They certainly take their lives in their hands. What with the weather and all.
answer: Yes, Janet. Life's pretty cheap to that type.

question: What's the matter Brad, darling?
answer: I think we took the wrong fork a few miles back.

question: Oh dear! But then where did the motorcyclists come from?
answer: Hmmm ... Well, I guess we will have to turn back.

question: What was that bang?
answer: We must have a blow-out.

question: Oh...
answer: You'd better sit here and keep warm while I go for help.

question: But where will you go? We're in the middle of nowhere.
answer: Didn't we pass a castle back down the road a few miles? Maybe they have a telephone I might use.

question: I'm coming with you.
answer: There's no point both of us getting wet.

question: There's a light.
answer: Over at the Frankenstein place.

question: There's a light.
answer: Burning in the fireplace. There's a light, a light.

question: Let's do the Time Warp again. Let's do the Time Warp again.
answer: It's just a jump to the left.

question: And a step to the right - right - right - right - right.
answer: With your hands on your hips.

question: Let's do the Time Warp again. Let's do the Time Warp again.
answer: It's just a jump to the left.

question: And then a step to the right.
answer: With your hands on your hips.

question: Oh....Say something.
answer: Say! Do any of you guys know the Madison?

question: Brad, please lets get out of here.
answer: For God's sake keep a grip on yourself Janet.

question: But it seems so unhealthy here.
answer: It's just a..a party Janet.

question: Well I want to leave.
answer: We can't go anywhere until I get to a phone.

question: Then ask the butler - or someone.
answer: Let's wait awhile Janet. We don't want to interfere with their celebrations.

question: This isn't the Junior Chamber of Commerce Brad.
answer: They're probably foreigners with ways different from our own. - They may do some more folk dancing.

question: Brad - I'm cold, I'm wet, and plain scared.
answer: I'm here, there's nothing to worry about.

question: You got caught with a flat Well how about that Well babies don't you panic By the light of the night It'll seem alright I'll get you a satanic mechanic. I'm just a sweet transvestite From Transexual Transylvania. Why dont'cha stay for the night I'm just a sweet transvestite From Transexual Transylvania.
answer: "Sweet Transvestite"

question: From Transexual Transylvania.
answer: "Transylvania"

question: The Sword of Damocles is Hanging over my head. And I've got the feeling Someone's going to be Cutting the thread. I woke up this morning With a start When I fell out of bed. And left from my dreaming Was a feeling Of un-nameable dread.
answer: That ain't no crime

question: My high is low. I'm dressed up With no place to go. Oh, no no, no no.
answer: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

question: No no no, no no.
answer: Sha la la la That ain't no crime - That ain't no crime.

question: That ain't no crime. That ain't no crime. Sha la la la That ain't no crime.
answer: Oh no no no no.

question: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.
answer: No no no no.

question: Sha la la la That ain't no crime. That ain't no crime. Sha la la la That ain't no crime.
answer: No no no no.

question: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.
answer: No no no no.

question: Who is it? Who's there? Oh, Brad, come in, darling. Oh Brad - Mmmm - Oh yes, my darling - what if...
answer: It's alright Janet. Everything's going to be alright.

question: Oh, I hope so my darling. But let me switch on the light.
answer: No, don't do that.

question: Oh don't be so shy. YOU!
answer: I'm afraid so, Janet. But isn't it nice?

question: You beast, you monster, what have you done with Brad?
answer: Nothing. Why, do you think I should?

question: You tricked me - I wouldn't have - I've never - never
answer: I know. But it wasn't all bad was it? In fact, I think you found it quite pleasurable. Mmmmm so soft, so sensual.

question: Oh - Oh - no - stop - I mean help. I - Brad - Oh. Brad.
answer: Ssssh. Brad's probably asleep by now. Do you want him to see you like this?

question: Like this - like how? It's your fault. You're to blame. I was saving myself.
answer: Well, I'm sure you're not spent yet.

question: Don't worry Janet, we'll be away from here in the morning. Hmmmm, you smell so good.
answer: Oh Brad. Oh no. Not till after the wedding, Darling.

question: Alright, Janet. I understand.
answer: Maybe we could try it this way.

question: Janet! Oh! Yes it's alright. Janet. Everything's going to be alright.
answer: I hope so my darling.

question: You!
answer: I'm afraid so, Brad. But wasn't it nice?

question: Why you - what have you done with Janet?
answer: Nothing. Why do you think I should?

question: You tricked me. I wouldn't have - I've never - never.
answer: I know, but it wasn't all bad was it? I think you found it quite pleasurable. Oh so soft. So sensual.

question: Ahhh - no - stop - I mean Janet. Janet.
answer: Shush. Janet's probably asleep by now. Do you want her to see you like this?

question: Like this. Like how? It's your fault - you're to blame. I thought it was the real thing.
answer: Oh come on, Brad, admit it. It was enjoyable, wasn't it? There's no crime in giving yourself over to pleasure.

question: You promise you won't tell?
answer: On my mother's grave.

question: If only we hadn't made this journey. If only the car hadn't broken down. If only we were amongst friends or sane persons.
answer: "If" and "Only", two small words. Words which kept repeating themselves again and again in Janet's thoughts. But it was too late to go back now. It was as if she were riding a giant tidal wave. It would be folly to fight against it. Her only chance would be to ride it out - adapt - and perhaps also to survive.

question: Yes. There you see it's instinctive. This room is your womb. You returned here for one thing - security. Oh Brad! What have they done with him? Ahhh! Oh Brad. How could you? Oh, but you're hurt. Did they do this to you? Here, lie down. I'll dress your wounds.
answer: "Emotion". Mental agitation - an excited state of. It is also an irrational and powerful master and from what Janet had witnessed on the monitor, there seemed to be little doubt that she was indeed its slave.

question: Aaaargh! Mercy.
answer: How did it happen? I understood you were to be watching.

question: I was only away for a minute Master.
answer: Well, see if you can find him on the monitor.

question: I most certainly do. He happens to be an old friend of mine.
answer: I see. So this wasn't simply a chance meeting. You came here with a purpose.

question: I told you, my car broke down. I was telling the truth.
answer: I know what you told me, Brad. But this Dr Everett Scott. His name is not unknown to me.

question: He was a Science Teacher at Denton High.
answer: And now he works for your Government, doesn't he, Brad? He's attached to the Bureau of Investigation of that which you call U.F.O's. Isn't he, Brad?

question: He might be. I don't know.
answer: Hmmmm. He'll be in the Zen Room. Well, let's ask him.

question: It's not easy having a good time. My children turn on me. Rocky's behaving just as Eddie did. Maybe I made a mistake in splitting his brain between the two of them.
answer: When will we return to Transylvania? I grow weary of this world.

question: Magenta, I am indeed grateful to both you and your brother RIff Raff - you have both served me well - loyalty such as yours must be rewarded and you will discover when the mood takes me I can be quite generous.
answer: I ask for nothing, Master.

question: Wait! I can explain. On the day I went away.
answer: Goodbye

question: Was all I had to say
answer: Now I

question: Want to come again and stay
answer: Oh my, my,

question: Smile and that will mean I may I've seen blue skies Through the tears in my eyes And I realise I'm going home I'm going home
answer: Feeling

question: Like I'm outside in the rain
answer: Wheeling

question: Free to try and find a game
answer: Dealing

question: They didn't like me. They never liked me.
answer: You did right.

question: A decision had to be made.
answer: You're OK by me.

question: Dr Scott I'm sorry about your nephew.
answer: Yes, well perhaps it was for the best.
